content:
When I try to log in at https://www.hl7.org/concalls/, I get a warning from Firefox saying the connection is insecure:

pasted image
@David Johnson does this have anything to do with site migration?
Paul, thanks for sharing this. I've taken a look and see that our certificate is valid through 4/18 certified by LetsEncrypt.
If you use a different browser, do you get the same thing? I ask because it may be that your version of Firefox may not be accepting LetsEncrypt as a Certificate Authority.
It may also be something as simple as our login page sending you back from https://qcommerce.hl7.org/ to a non-secure HTTP://www.hl7.org. I'm checking that now.
I tried Chrome. There, after logging on on the /concalls page (https), I was taken to http://hl7.org (no https). When I returned to https://www.hl7.org/concalls/, I was still not logged in.

I think the problem is the tag for the submit button "Transfer.aspx" page to which one gets sent (briefly) after submitting the login page:

      <input type="submit" name="mybutton" value="" onclick="javascript:WebForm_DoPostBackWithOptions(new WebForm_PostBackOptions("mybutton", "", false, "", "http://www.hl7.org/login/singlesignon.cfm", false, false))" id="mybutton" style="height:1px;width:1px;" />

Notice that the URL for "singlesignon.cfm" is http. It should probably be https.

FWIW, Here is what I did to get that warning (Firefox on windows, no special options or extensions). The sequence was:

  1. Accessed https://www.hl7.org/concalls/
  2. Clicked on the sign-in link
  3. Got redirected to the qcommerce HL7 sign-on page
  4. At this point, as I clicked on the login button, I got a warning "The information you have entered on this page will be sent over an insecure connection and could be read by a third party. Are you sure you want to send this information?" After confirming, I was logged in, and got redirected to the HL7 home page.
  5. Accessed https://www.hl7.org/concalls/ and I was logged in.
@David Johnson Any updates? This also happens when trying to register for the WGM.

Paul, I'm working with the vendor to get a return to the SSL version of the page. I believe the alert you are seeing is happening because it is hard-coded to go back to http://www.hl7.org/ instead of https://www.hl7.org/
The vendor website is compiled and no .cs files exist making it impossible for me to affect the change without an update on their part
Have you experienced what Vassil outlined above?

David Johnson said:

Have you experienced what Vassil outlined above?

I have not been willing to say "okay" to that dialog. I don't get the dialog on Chrome, but I do get redirected to http://www.hl7.org/. It is really odd to be redirected there after logging in, when trying to get registered for the WGM, but after going there and then clicking again on the registration link, I found I was logged in.
I agree it is a substandard experience despite successful login and have increased the priority of the support ticket with our vendor. I appreciate you sharing your experience.
I have applied an update prior to a vendor resolution as I fear one might not be coming. Please try your login again.
